title: Ticket #3930: Allow better specification of DAGMan default/workflow log file path
description:
In DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG, we should be able to usefully specify something in the global config file. For example, something like 

  DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG = $(SPOOL)/$(DAG).$(PROCESS).node_log

and maybe the default should be 

  DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG = $(DAG).$(PROCESS).node_log

That would reduce the chance of log file collisions, which will goof things up...

Note: We should check whether macro substitution already works, given that DAGMan uses the daemoncore param code.

2013-Nov-20 14:07:33 by wenger:
Note: VALID_SPOOL_FILES allows a single "*" in each specification, so I guess the workflow log files could go into the spool directory if you're really careful in your VALID_SPOOL_FILES setting and how you structure the file names. Probably the log directory would be a better place, though, because in that directory files are assumed to be okay, as opposed to the spool directory, where they're assumed to be not okay.

Created branch V8_1-gittrac_3930-branch for this.

2013-Nov-21 12:52:38 by wenger:
I've started working on this, and I've run into some complications.

First of all, I was hoping to allow something like this: 

  DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG = $(LOG)/$(DAG_FILE).nodes_log

or 

  DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG = $(SPOOL)/$(DAG_FILE).nodes_log

But there are a few problems:

  • $(SPOOL) probably isn't a great place for the log files, because condor_preen will delete them unless you change its configuration.
  • $(LOG) does not work in this expression because the command-line argument to condor_dagman sets LOG to ".".
  • $(DAG_FILE) gets substituted with "" by the param system before DAGMan ever sees it.

It turns out you can do $(LOCAL_DIR)/log instead of $(LOG) to stick the files in the log directory, so I guess that's a way to deal with it.

As far as the $(DAG_FILE) problem, the main idea I've thought of so far is to use a different character instead of "$" -- maybe "@". So you'd get something like this: 

  DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG = $(LOCAL_DIR)/log/@(DAG_FILE).nodes.log

I don't really like this business of having two different symbols for dereferencing the macros, but I also haven't thought of a good alternative so far...

2013-Nov-22 13:35:44 by wenger:
Just a note on this -- if condor_preen removes the workflow log during a run, all kinds of problems will result...

As per Friday's LIGO phone call, I'm going to just go ahead and implement this as I have it now. I'll also create a derived ticket for possibly cleaning things up, so that we can prioritize that separately.

2013-Nov-26 11:35:50 by wenger:
This is fixed for 8.1.3, so I'm going to resolve this ticket. (Also note derived ticket #4099.)
